HTML_RECIPENAME: Instant Pot Rajma Masala | Pressure Cooker Rajma Masala
HTML_RECIPEDESCRIPTION: Rajma or Razma Masala, is a popular vegetarian curry originating from North India. This North Indian melt-in-your-mouth kidney Bean Curry is made with rajma. In this curry, red kidney beans are soaked overnight, cooked in a spicy and thick onion tomato gravy consisting whole and powdered spices. For this Instant Pot Rajma Masala recipe, I cooked my rajma masala on high pressure for 35 minutes. But you can also make the Rajma masala using “Bean/Chili” mode.
KEYWORDS: punjabi rajma instant pot, authentic punjabi rajma recipe, instant pot rajma chawal recipe, rajma masala in instant pot, instant pot rajma canned beans, instant pot rajma pulao, instant pot rajma recipe, instant pot rajma dal, easy instant pot rajma, instant pot indian rajma recipes, 	instant pot rajma masala, pressure cooker rajma, punjabi rajma masala curry recipe, authentic punjabi rajma recipe
MY_INGREDIENTS_FINAL:
!!Ingredients
2 cups rajma (kidney beans), it would become 3 cups after soaking overnight
1 bay leaf (tej patta)
2-3 cloves
salt to taste
2 onions, chopped
2 tomatoes, chopped
1 tablespoon ginger, chopped
2 tablespoons garlic, chopped
2 tablespoons oil
3  green chilies, slit
1/2 teaspoon cumin seeds
2 teaspoon coriander powder (dhaniya powder)
1 teaspoon cumin powder (jeera powder)
1/4 teaspoon roasted cumin powder (bhuna jeera powder)
1 teaspoon red chilli powder (lal mirch powder)
1/2 teaspoons garam masala powder
1/2 tablespoons powdered kasuri methi, optional (dried fenugreek leaves)
3 cups water or more if required
MY_INSTRUCTIONS_FINAL:
!!Instructions
Take a mixing bowl. Combine the yogurt, watermelon, onion, cumin powder, chaat masala, and salt and whisk well.
Garnish with your favorite, green chiles, Top with chopped almonds, and serve with crackers, chips or fruits.

HTML_RECIPENAME: Bhutte Ka Kees Recipe | Grated Corn Stir Fry
HTML_RECIPEDESCRIPTION: Bhutte ka Kees or Grated Corn Stir Fry is a famous and delectable North Indian street food originated from the city of  Indore in Madhya Pradesh, India. Bhutte Ka Kees has a rich creamy texture and delectable taste. This dish is one of such snacks which is admired by the people of all ages. This simple-to-cook Indore special snack is made especially during the monsoon or winter season. This tasty and filling snack can be served an evening snack, brunch, appetizer or even as breakfast.
KEYWORDS: bhutte ka kees indore, bhutte ka meetha kees, recipe of bhutte ki kees, bhutte ki kees banane ka tarika, bhutte ka kis, bhutte ka kis recipe, bhutte ka kees kaise banate hai, bhutte ki kees in hindi, भुट्टे का किस बनाना है, grated corn stir fry, grated corn snack, grated corn snack, indian snacks for party, indian snacks for picnic, indian snacks with tea, indian snacks at home, indian snacks for potluck
MY_INGREDIENTS_FINAL:
!!For Bhutte Ka Kees:
3 medium sized corn cobs or sweet corn (bhutta or makai)
4 tablespoon oil 
1/4 tsp asafoetida (hing)
3/4 teaspoon mustard seeds (rai)
3/4 teaspoon cumin seeds (jeera)
2 tablespoons green chilies, chopped (kati hui hari mirch)
1 tablespoon grated ginger (kisi hui adrak)
1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder (haldi)
1 teaspoon red chili powder 
1 teaspoon coriander powder (dhania powder) 
3/4 cup milk
1/2 cup water (I washed my grater in 1/2 cup of water and used that water)
Salt to taste required
1 tablespoons ghee (clarified butter)
2 tablespoons chopped coriander leaves
2 teaspoons lemon juice or as required
1 teaspoon sugar (optional)
!!For Serving:
Grated fresh coconut
Roasted, roughly crushed peanuts
Chopped coriander leaves
MY_INSTRUCTIONS_FINAL:
!!How to grate corn kernels:
For this recipe, you need corn on the cob which have milkier and plump kernels. To check, if the corn is milky and plump insert a knife or toothpick in a kernel and if it bursts with milk then the corn is perfect. 
Now, grate corn off the cob. Once you have grated corn, set is aside. Also, rinse used grater in 1/2 cup of water. Keep it aside too.
!!How to cook Bhutte Ka Kees:
Heat a deep-bottomed pan over medium heat.
Heat oil or ghee in the pan.
Once hot, add asafoetida, mustard seeds and cumin seeds. 
When the seeds start to crackle add green chilies in it and sauté for 1 minute. 
Now add grated ginger and sauté for 1 more minute.
Now add turmeric powder, coriander powder and red chili powder.
Sauté masala powders in oil for 1 minute.
Now add grated corn mixture, water, and mix well. Cook for 6-7 minutes or until the color changes slightly. Keep stirring continuously. 
Now add milk and stir well. Cover and cook for 8-10 minutes over low heat. Stir it every 2 minutes.
Uncover the pan, and turn the heat to medium. Cook until mixture thickens. 
Once the mixture thickens, add the salt and mix until combined.   
Add sugar and mix well.
Then add ghee and mix well again. 
Add chopped coriander leaves and mix. 
Once done, turn off the flame and add lemon juice and mix well. 
!!How to serve Bhutte Ka Kees: 
Transfer bhutte ka kees into a serving dish and top with grated coconut, roasted peanuts and coriander leaves. 
Serve immediately and enjoy with hot tea.
HTML_RECIPE_NOTES:
1. Sugar is optional in this recipe. If you want it 'Khatta Meetha' (tangy and sweet), like an Indori, then add it.
2. For the recipe, always use corn on the cob which have milkier and plump kernels.
3. This dish requires some extra oil, because Bhutte Ka Kees tastes great when it is cooked in ample amount oil/ghee. However, if you are not comfortable with 4 tablespoons of oil, then you can surely reduce the amount of oil/ghee.
